00005 #include <fstream>
00006 
00007 #include "NonmemTranslator.h"
00008 #include "SpkCompilerException.h"
00009 
00010 #include <xercesc/dom/DOMDocument.hpp>
00011 #include <xercesc/dom/DOM.hpp>
00012 #include <xercesc/util/XMLString.hpp>
00013 
00014 using namespace std;
00015 using namespace xercesc;
00016 
00017 //=============================================================================
00018 //
00019 // parse <monte_carlo>
00020 //
00021 // Pre-conditions - (Nothing really)
00022 //
00023 // Post-condtions -  The following variables are set to valid values:
00024 //                     myIntegMethod
00025 //                     myIntegNEvals
00026 //                     myIntegNumberEvals (vector)
00027 //
00028 //=============================================================================
00029 void NonmemTranslator::parseMonte( const DOMElement* monte_carlo )
00030 {
00031   assert( monte_carlo != NULL );
00032   if( monte_carlo->hasAttribute( XML.X_METHOD ) )
00033     {
00034       const XMLCh* x_temp = monte_carlo->getAttribute( XML.X_METHOD );
00035       if( XMLString::equals( x_temp, XML.X_ADAPT ) )
00036     myIntegMethod = ADAPT;
00037       else if( XMLString::equals( x_temp, XML.X_GRID ) )
00038     myIntegMethod = GRID;
00039       else if( XMLString::equals( x_temp, XML.X_MISER ) )
00040     myIntegMethod = MISER;
00041       else if( XMLString::equals( x_temp, XML.X_VEGAS ) )
00042     myIntegMethod = VEGAS;
00043       else if( XMLString::equals( x_temp, XML.X_PLAIN ) )
00044     myIntegMethod = PLAIN;
00045       else
00046       {  char method_in_file[21];
00047      char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00048 
00049          // convert from XMLString to string
00050          XMLString::transcode(x_temp, method_in_file, 20);
00051 
00052          // construct the error message
00053          snprintf( mess, 
00054        SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00055        "<%s::%s> attribute = %s", 
00056            XML.C_MONTE_CARLO, 
00057            XML.C_METHOD, 
00058            method_in_file
00059          );
00060          SpkCompilerException e( 
00061            SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, 
00062            mess,
00063        __LINE__,
00064            __FILE__
00065          );
00066          throw e;
00067       }
00068     }
00069   else
00070     {
00071       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00072       snprintf( mess, 
00073         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00074         "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.", XML.C_MONTE_CARLO, XML.C_METHOD );
00075       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess,
00076                   __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00077       throw e;
00078     }
00079   DOMNodeList * number_evals = monte_carlo->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_NUMBEREVAL );
00080   if( number_evals->getLength() < 1 )
00081     {
00082       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00083       snprintf( mess, 
00084         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00085         "Missing <%s> element!", XML.C_NUMBEREVAL );
00086       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR,
00087                   mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00088       throw e;
00089     }
00090   DOMElement  * number_eval  = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( number_evals->item(0) );
00091   DOMNodeList * value_list = number_eval->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_VALUE );
00092   myIntegNEvals = value_list->getLength();
00093   if( myIntegNEvals < 1 )
00094     {
00095       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00096       snprintf( mess, 
00097         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00098         "Missing <%s> element!",
00099            XML.C_VALUE );
00100       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR,
00101                   mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00102       throw e;
00103     }
00104 
00105   // Only when the integration method is GRID, the number of function evaluations is
00106   // something other then 1.  Actually it is equal to the order of OMEGA (ie. the length of ETA).
00107   if( myIntegMethod == GRID )
00108     {
00109       if( myIntegNEvals != myEtaLen )
00110         {
00111       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00112       snprintf( mess, 
00113             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00114             "The number <%s> elements must be equal to the length of ETA (%d) for grid and miser approximation!", 
00115            XML.C_VALUE, myEtaLen );
00116       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR,
00117                   mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00118       throw e;
00119         }
00120     }
00121   else // adapt, plain, miser, vegas
00122     {
00123       // For these methods, ignore what the user says.
00124       // They take only one and the first occurence of <number_eval>.
00125       myIntegNEvals = 1;
00126     }
00127   myIntegNumberEvals.resize( myIntegNEvals );
00128   for( int i=0; i<myIntegNEvals; i++ )
00129     {
00130       DOMElement * value = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( value_list->item(i) );
00131       const XMLCh * x_value = value->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();
00132       unsigned int temp_value = 0;
00133       XMLString::textToBin( x_value, temp_value );
00134       myIntegNumberEvals[i] = temp_value;
00135     }
00136 }
